53.heading: Little, Jason.
53.title: Shutterbug Follies
53.author: Jason Little.
notes: "Bee works as a photo-finishing technician in a one-hour lab in lower Manhattan. To amuse herself, she duplicates, for her own collection, any titillating photographs that happen to pass through her hands. When pictures of a naked corpse are left for processing, Bee's curiousity goes into high gear."

56.heading: Little, Jason--Miscellanea.
56.title: "En Variant le Style"
56.author: Thierry Groensteen
56.appears_in: p. 88-90 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 10 (Apr. 2004).
notes: Begins: "Rejeton ou succursale de l'Oulipo, l'Oubapo à son tour fait des petits, particulièrement dans le monde anglo-saxon. Aus États-Unis, le dessinateur Matt Madden est depuis 2001 la cheville ouvrière d'un groupe auquel participent Tom Motley, Tom Hart et Jason Little, avec le renfort occasionnel de James Kochalka, Jon Lewis, Tad Suiter ou Tim Hamilton."

English summary (from p. 127): "Variations in Style. Official correspondent of Oubapo in the States, Matt Madden is presently creating a comic that is to be the equivalent of Raymond Queneau's Exercises de Style: he tells the same anecdote in 99 different ways. Here is a preview of a small sample."

109.heading: Little Annie Fanny--Miscellanea.
109.title: The History of the Comics [videorecording]
109.author: EPISA (Euskal Pictures International, S
109.appears_in: A.) ; co-production, ETB (Euskal Telebista) ; The Department of Culture of the Basque government ; with support from the Spanish Ministry of Culture ; producer, Iñigo Silva ; director, Alejandro Vallejo ; script, Carmen Dominguez, Alejandro Vallejo.
notes: 4 VHS videocassettes (ca. 360 min.) : sd., col. and b&w ; 1/2 in.

Summary: Four-part series on the history of comics. Volume 1 follows the beginnings of comics and some of the comic book characters that were popular during the turn of the century, World War I, the Roaring '20s and the Great Depression. Volume 2 deals with the superheroes and characters with superhuman powers that are still popular today, just as they were 40 and 50 years ago. It also discusses how the 1950s and 1960s inspired the creation of a whole new cast of comic characters for a baby boom generation. Volume 3 looks at the underground movement of the 1960s and the alternative-style comics it produced that ferociously attacked society. It also discusses the superheroes of the 1970s and 1980s and the impact of the Punk movement on comics. Volume 4 wraps up the series with the new changes in comics, from superheroes who are becoming more human to dealing with ecological disasters and drugs. The program also looks at the future of comics and features today's young artists and writers.
Contents v 1: The Katzenjammer kids ; Betty Boop ; Little Orphan Annie ; Popeye ; Tarzan ; Gasoline Alley ; Dick Tracy ; Flash Gordon ; The Phantom.
v. 2: Superman ; Batman ; Steve Canyon ; Peanuts ; Captain America ; James Bond ; Beetle Bailey ; Mad ; Andy Capp.
v. 3: Vampirella ; Conan ; Furry Freak Brothers ; Spider-Man ; Little Annie Fanny ; Incredible Hulk ; Fantastic Four ; Creepy magazine ; Judge Dredd.
v. 4: X-Men ; Outland ; Heavy Metal ; Green Arrow ; Watchmen ; Atom ; Elf Quest ; Ronin ; Green Lantern.

139.title: Little Annie Rooney

notes: Summary: The owner of the lost money thinks there's no point in advertising for it.

140.title: Little Annie Rooney

notes: Summary: Annie refuses a reward when she returns the money to its owner.

141.title: Little Annie Rooney
141.author: by Brandon Walsh ; Darrell McClure.
141.series: July 27, 1933) "That Little Orphan Made a Big Hit With Me"*
notes: Summary: The rich man wants to reward Annie somehow. He is shown carrying a golf bag.

142.title: Little Annie Rooney
142.author: by Brandon Walsh ; Darrell McClure.
142.series: July 28, 1933) "It Frightens Annie When You Question Her About Her Past"*
notes: Summary: Mrs. Reeal tells the rich man what little she knows about Annie.

143.title: Little Annie Rooney
143.author: by Brandon Walsh ; Darrell McClure.
143.series: July 29, 1933) "The Cheap Stiff, Giving You Candy Instead of a Hundred Bucks"*
notes: Summary: Annie is happy with the box of candy, and shares it with everyone in the circus.

144.title: Little Annie Rooney
144.author: Darrell McClure.
144.series: Jan. 1934) "Look, Zero, 'The Cleanly Laundry.' Don't it Look Grand?"*
notes: Summary: The new laundry isn't as dangerous an investment as oil stock.
Strip undated except for copyright year; probably from Jan. 1934.

145.title: Little Annie Rooney
145.author: Darrell McClure.
145.series: Sept. 12, 1935) "I Guess if Folks has a Kind Heart, the Rest Don't Matter, Much"*
notes: Summary: Zero gets a bath in preparation for meeting Aunt Martha, while Annie tells him her troubles.

146.title: Little Annie Rooney
146.author: Darrell McClure.
146.series: Sept. 27, 1935) "When Miss Blake, My Teacher, Looked at Your Picture, She Thought You was a Sheep"*
notes: Summary: Aunt Martha wants to adopt Annie, and meanwhile Annie drew a picture of Zero in school.

175.heading: Little Apple.
175.title: The Adventures of Captain Underpants : an epic novel
175.author: by Dav Pilkey.
notes: Summary: George and Harold hypnotize their principal into thinking that he is the superhero Captain Underpants.
Includes some brief flip animation sequences.

176.heading: Little Apple.
176.title: Captain Underpants and the Attack of the Talking Toilets : Another Epic Novel
176.author: by Dav Pilkey.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): Principal Krupp once again turns into the superhero Captain Underpants in order to save the world, and Jerome Horwitz Elementary School, from the evil talking toilets and the Turbo Toilet 2000.

177.heading: Little Apple.
177.title: Captain Underpants and the Invasion of the Incredibly Naughty Cafeteria Ladies from Outer Space
177.author: by Dav Pilkey.
177.series: and the Subsequent Assault of the Equally Evil Lunchroom Zombie Nerds) : the Third Epic Novel
notes: Summary (from OCLC): Only Captain Underpants can stop the three evil space aliens who have invaded Jerome Horwitz Elementary School and turned everyone into lunchroom zombie nerds.

178.heading: Little Apple.
178.title: Maximum Boy, Starring in Meet Super Sid, Crime-Fighting Kid
178.author: by Dan Greenburg ; illustrations by Greg Swearingen.
notes: Summary: "They cheer. They shout! The crowd's gone wild! They can't get enough of the world's greatest superhero. He's loyal and brave. Mature and handsome. Smart, athletic

Whoa! Wait just a second. Mature? Handsome? Athletic? They're not cheering for our skinny eleven-year-old, are they? This crowd's gone nuts for Super Sid, Crime-fighting Kid. Better move over, Maximum Boy, looks like there's a new superhero in town."

179.heading: Little Apple.
179.title: Scooby-Doo! and the Fairground Phantom
179.author: written by James Gelsey.
notes: At head of title: Cartoon Network.
Summary (from OCLC): Scooby and the gang are enjoying the county fair until a Revolutionary War ghost shows up and ruins even Shaggy's appetite.

180.heading: Little Apple.
180.title: Scooby-Doo! and the Mummy's Curse
180.author: written by James Gelsey.
notes: At head of title: Cartoon Network.

Summary: "Scooby-Doo and the gang are watching the filming of a new movie, The Sands of Cairo. A real mummy's tomb, with jewels and treasures, is on the set. When creepy things start happening, the director thinks the mummy's tomb is cursed."
